Minneapolis.Lake Calhoun: Lake Calhoun, also known as Bde Maka Ska (English pronunciation: ), is the largest lake in Minneapolis, Minnesota, and part of the city's Chain of Lakes. Surrounded by city park land and circled by bike and walking trails, it is popular for many outdoor activities. The lake has an area of 401 acres (1.62 km2) and a maximum depth of 87 feet (27 m).
